instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCCSA_S0_CPU: What is PPVCCSA_S0_CPU? Main power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. This is NOT shorted to ground if it has a low resistance â€“ this is a common mistake people make. A chip that requires high power at a low voltage like a CPU or GPU will have a low measured resistance to ground..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans spin no display, no chime, no lights, Short on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
OK so I have some knowledge of electronics but not with schematics and this level of components. I am trying to power <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GPU</SIGNAL> with my bench supply but not sure how to find the start of that circuit. I have the schematic and board view open but finding the start of each rail after 12v is beyond me.

I won't ask for anyone to hold my hand but banging my head on the desk at this point isn't working out well.  Where do I start and should I even be trying to power this rail to start or do something else. I am getting shorts on 20 or so components and all are related to <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GPU</SIGNAL> when I check them in board view. I am also getting 0.8v on this rail when I believe I should be getting around 1.1-1.2 if I am not mistaken.

Thanks.

Edit:  <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH1</SIGNAL> also shorted which I am assuming comes before <SIGNAL>SO_GPU</SIGNAL>.

Edit2: Ok I'm stupid CPU rail also has a short. I am working backwards here when I think I need to work forwards. Not sure where the hell to look to find trace down where it all begins.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans spin no display, no chime, no lights, Short on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum.

Wht didn't post the exact ohm value for these "shorts".
Do not assume so fast a short; CPU/GPU power rails have very low values as normal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans spin no display, no chime, no lights, Short on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Short to GND is around 1ohm on these 4 or 5 caps near the GPU and goes up from there as I move outward. Ranging from 4ohms up to 50.

Thanks for your time.

Edit: they're actually showing 0.8 but my probes read 0.4 so I suppose its closer to that actually.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans spin no display, no chime, no lights, Short on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
1 ohm could be normal value.
Can be only confirmed 100% comparing with good board.

threads.message:

1 ohm could be normal value.

1ohm on a cap?

Getting dead shorts on all the inductors in the area as well.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans spin no display, no chime, no lights, Short on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"1ohm on a cap?"
Why not, if that cap is on CPU/GPU VCORE???
i7 and newer CPUs have very low values...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans spin no display, no chime, no lights, Short on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message: OK so should I start with DFU you think then. I don't own another mac so I would need to procure one. I don't see any other signs of faults and all rails are present. Fans spin etc. No lights however.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans spin no display, no chime, no lights, Short on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message: You don't lose anything trying DFU restore...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans spin no display, no chime, no lights, Short on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message: OK so I finally did DFU restore and afterwards I still got no display but just to see I tried to blindly boot it into target disk and it showed up on my host machine. So I then got a USB C hub and it shows video on external display. So I am unsure where to go from here as I don't have a display to test it with and not sure if I could even find one. And I don't want to order one and send it back because...ya know that's kinda shitty.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fans spin no display, no chime, no lights, Short on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Is this machine out of warranty?
Apple has replace program for LCD assembly issues.
